derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French infanterie, from Italian infanteria, from infante 'youth, infantryman', from Latin infant- (see infant)

entry.def: Infantry are soldiers who fight on foot rather than in tanks or on horses.

example.ex: The infantry were advancing to attack the ridge...
example.tran: 步兵部队正在向前挺进攻打山脊。

means.word_mean: 1. an army unit consisting of soldiers who fight on foot;

sentences.sentence: "there came ten thousand horsemen and as many fully-armed foot"
